result.execSummary:
The defendant Gary A Bass was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Operate Firearm While Intoxicated [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).
  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Door County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action including court appointed attorney fees due Door County. Cash bond applied.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervison fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Hand gun to be destroyed.  Defendant can petition court for early termination of probation after 2 years upon successful completion of all conditions of probation and with recommendation from probation agent.

timeConds.notes: Jail time applies to Ct. 1 - STAYED, as long as defendant has all recommended assessments and is in compliance within 60 days. Remains stayed only as long as defendant continues to comply with all conditions of probation. If stay is lifted, huber release is granted.

records.addlTxt: from Plea & Sentencing Hearing dated 3/20/15
of Conviction - Court imposes 45 days jail time.
Court appointed attorney bill from Linda Schaefer.

Defendant Gary A Bass in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Cts. 1, 2 & 4. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 1, 2 & 4. Court dismisses Ct. 3 but reads in for sentencing. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Bond is no longer in effect.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea.  Bond remains as is.
State's Discovery Demand

Defendant Gary A Bass in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Status conference scheduled for March 20, 2015 at 10:30 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant Gary A Bass in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defendant files Petition for Appointment of Counsel form for court to review. Defendant to talk Atty Schaeffer and return. Defendant returns with Atty Schaefer. Court appoints Atty Linda Schaefer to represent defendant. Defendant to pay $50 per month. First payment due by 3/01/15. Defense waives reading of the complaint, requests status within time limits or as close to the 20 day time limit. Return 2/23/15 at 8:00 am. Bond remains in effect.
Defendant was fingerprinted 1/26/15 by jail staff. (fingerprint card destroyed 3/27/15)
No contact direct or indirect with M.B. or residence at 1842 County ZZ.   Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. Not to possess firearms.

Defendant Gary A Bass in court.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not qualify for PD representation.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 2/02/15 at 10:00 am.
by Dustin Bass
